meanings.definition: To assess or determine the value of something again.
meanings.sent1: She revaluates her stamp collection every year to see if any are rare.
meanings.sent2: The real estate agent revaluates the property after renovations to set a new price.
meanings.sent3: John revaluates his decision to wear shorts in the snow.
meanings.sent4: The scientist revaluates her hypothesis after unexpected results.
meanings.sent5: The teacher revaluates the students' progress to adjust her teaching methods.

meanings.definition: To reconsider or review something for a second time.
meanings.sent1: After the feedback, she revaluates her presentation to make it more engaging.
meanings.sent2: The committee revaluates the budget to allocate funds more efficiently.
meanings.sent3: Tom revaluates his choice of toppings on the pizza for the third time.
meanings.sent4: The coach revaluates the team's strategy to secure a win in the final game.
meanings.sent5: The manager revaluates the project timeline to meet the deadline.
